title: State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes, and Lies - Collection 31 (Rus
description:
State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes, and Lies - Collection 31 (Russia 7):

We have 35 titles here:

-  Amnesty Int. - 'Civilian Objects Were Undamaged'; Russia's Statements on its Attacks in Syria Unmasked (2015)

-  Amnesty Int. - Civilians in the Aftermath of War; the Georgia-Russia Conflict One Year On (2009)

-  Aron (Ed.) - Putin's Russia; How It Rose, How It is Maintained, and How It Might End (2015)

-  Bobic - Words or Swords; Russia's Strategies in Handling its Territorial Disputes (2013)

-  Chechnya; the Inner Abroad, International Crisis Group (June 2015)

-  Covington - Putin's Choice for Russia, Belfer Center, Harvard Kennedy School (Aug 2015)

-  Czuperski et al - Hiding in Plain Sight; Putin's War in Ukraine, Atlantic Council (2015)

-  Daalder et al - Preserving Ukraine's Independence, Resisting Russian Aggression; What the United States and NATO Must Do, Atlantic Council (2015)

-  Dowling - Russia at War; From the Mongol Conquest to Afghanistan, Chechnya, and Beyond (2015)

-  Ferrari (Ed.) - Beyond Ukraine; EU and Russia in Search of a New Relation (2015)

-  Figes - The Crimean War; a History (2010)

-  Foxall - Putin's Peninsula; Crimea's Annexation and Deterioration, Russia Studies Centre (March 2015)

-  Getty & Manning (Eds.) - Stalinist Terror; New Perspectives (1993)

-  Giles et al - The Russian Challenge, Chatham House Report (June 2015)

-  Griffin et al (Eds.) - Fascism Past and Present, West and East; an International Debate on Concepts and Cases.. (2014)

-  HRW - Barriers Everywhere; Lack of Accessibility for People with Disabilities in Russia (2013)

-  HRW - Russia-Syria, Extensive Recent Use of Cluster Munitions; Indiscriminate Attacks Despite Syria's Written Guarantees (Dec 2015)

-  Kasapoglu - Russia in Foreign Skies; Assessing Russian Air Operations in Syria and Violations of Turkish Airspace, EDAM (2015)

-  Khlevniuk - Stalin; New Biography of a Dictator (2015)

-  Klymenko - Human Rights Abuses in Russian-Occupied Crimea, Atlantic Council (2015)

-  Kremlin's Black Book; Russian War Against Ukraine (Feb 2015)

-  Kuzio - Ukraine; Democratization, Corruption, and the New Russian Imperialism (2015)

-  Laruelle - The 'Russian World'; Russia's Soft Power and Geopolitical Imagination (2015)

-  McNabb - Vladimir Putin and Russia's Imperial Revival (2016)

-  Mohseni (Ed.) - Disrupting the Chessboard; Perspectives on the Russian Intervention in Syria, Belfer Center, Harvard Kennedy School (Oct 2015)

-  Oushakine - The Patriotism of Despair; Nation, War, and Loss in Russia (2009)

-  Pacepa & Rychlak - Disinformation (2013)

-  per Concordiam - Rolling Backward; Russia's Troubled Relations with its Neighbors, Vol. 5, Issue 4 (2014)

-  Rousso (Ed.) - Stalinism and Nazism; History and Memory Compared (1999)

-  Slaveski - The Soviet Occupation of Germany; Hunger, Mass Violence, and the Struggle for Peace, 1945-1947 (2013)

-  Stanton - Russia, Sanctions and the Way Forward; Balancing Assertiveness with Engagement, Bertlsmann Foundation (2015)

-  Stephenson - Gangs of Russia; From the Streets to the Corridors of Power (2015)

-  Van Metre et al - The Ukraine-Russia Conflict; Signals and Scenarios for the Broader Region, U.S. Inst. of Peace (2015)

-  Villahermosa - Putin as Warlord, Modern War (Mar-Apr 2015)

-  Yashin & Shorina (Eds.) - Putin. War; an Independent Expert Report, Based on Materials from Boris Nemtsov (2015)
